direct_enhancements.reason: Both methods involve checking for the presence of an attribute ID in the list of unknown attributes.
The equals method depends on the attribute type for comparison, similar to how getAttributeType retrieves the type.
The equals method compares the data length, similar to how getDataLength calculates the length.
The equals method of the UnknownAttributesAttribute class relies on the equals method of the unknownAttributes list, which can be tested similarly.
Both methods involve processing the unknownAttributes list and ensuring data integrity, though for different purposes.
Both methods handle binary data and attribute IDs, though for different purposes (encoding vs. decoding).
